Reviews.Title: “Fairly inexpensive but for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: Melshesh
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the beds are comfortable and the staff was friendly. But the rooms are somewhat dated. More importantly for me, if you are noise sensitive this is NOT the place for you. My first room was ary loud with elevator motor noise coming thru the vent, even though I was not near the elevator. My second room might has well been on the freeway, despite the fact I was on the 17th floor. Finally, the Internet is rather slow.

Reviews.Title: “Hosted Small Meeting”
Reviews.Author: cerc b
Reviews.Content: As someone who hosts a good amount of small meetings the Sheraton LA Downtown fit our needs perfectly. The team serving us from the housemen to the banquet staff were great and attentive to needs of the attendees. The technology team was also an asset as they were present for the kickoff of the meeting to provide assistance to those having trouble getting onto wireless. My only comment would be that the ballroom had a constant squeaky fan noise-- when asked about it we were told that it was most likely the elevator/escalator fans from the Macy's Plaza. It was slightly distracting to the attendees but overall very successful meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 996cz
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton Downtown LA at least once every two months for business. Not only is the hotel in a great location for what I do, but I am always greeted with a smile and welcome back. The hotel is always meticulously clean and the rooms are great. My last trip I was in need of some extra care and Jason Reyes at the front desk was phenomenal. He was so helpful and he genuinly cared about my circumstances. He went above and beyond his job to make me feel taken care of. Thanks again Jason for your extraordinary help and amazing customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Better for conventions”
Reviews.Author: YS1_11
Reviews.Content: Your standard convention hotel. A little run-down, thin walls. Good size room, though and good service. Had a problem with the Expedia reservation which the hotel solved. The hotel is old and it sometimes show.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the LA Marathon and had a GREAT rate. For the price we paid it was a good deal. Beds were the standard and VERY comfortable. Hotel overall is an older hotel and it shows. We were "upgraded" to a corner room which had a great view. Unfortuantely it was right by the service elevator which we were told "doesn't run after midnight" So at 1 am it was still running. Hmmm. My big gripes relate to parking... NIGHTMARE would be a good term. For $28 you can park in a garage next to the hotel... it's really for the mall. The elevator system that serves that parking garage is by far one of the slowest I have ever seen. Plan to leave VERY early to allow time for the elevator (which also serves the Macy's department store?) When we checked out I had bell services take my luggage down and I drove over to get it... Valet was PACKED and just kept yelling at people "don't stop" with no real guidance on what they wanted you to do. Finally I pulled around the corner and went back to get my luggage... which was sitting unattended. I picked it up and loaded it myself. I didn't mind loading the luggage myself, but honestly ANYONE could have walked of with my stuff which included a computer bag. Not good IMHO! If I get the $139 rate again I will be back, but if not there are a lot better choices in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: mdtraveler1237
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown LA, close to the metro and near a lot of dining. They use the Bally's in the "mall" (two stories, about 20 stores) as their fitness center. It is a good place for cardio, but not much weight lifting equipment. I stayed on the club level and was suprised at the condition of the room. While it was clean, all the metal surfaces, air grates, access panel, electrical connection to the lights in the bathroom, had rust on them. Some of the grout was stained and there was some mildew. The drop ceiling in the entry area looked like the same that was in my elementary school 30 years ago. While all the public areas are beautiful, the maintenance and upkeep in the room was questionable. I would have expected more, especially on their club level. Other than maintenance it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Petertravel64
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a work meeting. very efficient reservation process and check-in. room was well appointed and bedding was very comfortable and plush.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: cookingal
Reviews.Content: My husband and istayed here from the 27th of Feb through the 2nd of March. I had sinus surgery at USC hospital on Feb 28. The staff was nothing short of amazing. Doris in hoousekeeping is so caring and thorough. Joselito in the belle service parked my car for me after my surgery. The area dwntown has an energetic fun vibe to it. There are several places to eat in the adjacent mall. My husband I just can't tank you all enough for allowing me to recover in this gorgeous hotel. Valorie k

Reviews.Title: “Of similar type hotels- you can do better than this one-its tired”
Reviews.Author: CSSnowshoer
Reviews.Content: Almost a week in this hotelâ€¦sigh, I knew it wasnâ€™t the best hotel option based on prior reviews but it was where my meetings were. I suggest that if folks have an option with a similar price, to pass on this hotel. But its not bad, just not the first choice. My room was kind of shabby around the edges- chipped paint here and there, some torn wallpaper. It was also incredibly stuffy. I called and maintenance reported the AC but they just gave me a fan (which helped.) The lobby has free internet, but the lobby is below ground level, small and busy-not a place to catch up on work. They have a few computers for guests to use, but two of the key boards were so well used the letters were worn off-not easy for poor typists or Europeans. I was also annoyed all week because I had to PAY to have a refrigerator in my room. Geez. On the plus side, the staff were all genuinely nice, and high energy. They made this property tolerable. And-coming from the east coast I woke at 4am hungry- and was saved by the Famima across the street. Itâ€™s a chain which actually stays open all night and has good sandwiches and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Tanya C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there many times for business and the employees treat their guests wonderful. At the front desk Lynda was willing to do anything to ensure a great stay. Ann was very upbeat and ready to provide me with everything to make me feel at home. Empoloyees keep the grounds clean and comfortable. I prefer this hotel over many others because of the great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great People Make a Hotel Great”
Reviews.Author: KorbinDallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the Sheraton name. The location is strictly for business, with the addition of sports and concerts at the Staples Center I bet. The hotel has been here awhile, but room decor and amenities have kept up with the times. My room was great in every way. Well worth the price. People really do make the difference, and you will find some of the best desk clerks here you will ever meet. The person who checked me in was exceptionally fast and friendly. I came back later and took advantage of no lines to ask another desk clerk a question or two about nearby attractions. He was full of suggestions and helped me with airport transportation the next day as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: jean1Chicago
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was professional, accomodating and efficient. Being connected to Macy's, a food court and other small shops provides options- especially for the single traveler. I usually attend a sporting event at Staples Center and eat and maybe see a movie at LA Live, and they're only a five-ten minute drive from the hotel. My room and the common areas were clean, the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Ammenities & Staff~”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJ1
Reviews.Content: Went on a business trip in LA and stayed at the Sheraton Downtown hotel. It was a nice hotel with good ammenities and friendly staff. Because I am a SPG I had a nice view on the 21st flr which included my own robe and a huge bottle of purified water. Beyond that the location, restuarant and other stores etc was great. I was treated nicely and would stay there again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice common areas, tired room”
Reviews.Author: HCopeJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property two nights, Feb 22-23. While the first floor amenities were good and the access to a fitness center was helpful, my room was tired at best and less than clean at worst. The room had rust stains in the bathroom, and the main room smelled musty. The hallways showed worn and buckled carpet, and needed a paint job. It definitely did not reflect a four-star rating as noted by several sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but the location could be better.”
Reviews.Author: WORLDSCITIZEN68
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by hotwire, and as we don't know the name of hotel we got, until we had already paid, i was worried about that, but the hotel itself, in my opinion matches to the 4 stars it has. The room was spacious, well cleaned and with nice amenities as tv, minibars,flat tv, nice furniture and nice bathroom. the hotel is not really new but is well maintained, nice lobby, free internet service (in the lobby) easy access to metro and a fitness gym (charged). There are a macys and many others shoppings located in the building where the hotel is. cons.: downtown is far from the most of sightseeing of LA, so is better stay in another neighborhood if you're as a tourist and i didn't feel safe walking in the streets at night. parking is expensive, You'll pay $ 28,00 a day for a self parking, vallet is a little bit more. But if you don't mind walking, there are some garage buildings near the hotel that are cheaper. breakfast is not free but you'll find many options in the hotel or in the complex of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Hey downtown”
Reviews.Author: RHai520
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I was in town visiting family. Sheratons are generally nice & decent but I wasn't liking the idea of having to stay downtown. Maricor at the front desk was really nice & friendly. She pointed out some really nice restaurants in the area & things to keep me occupied while I had time to kill.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Irayat
Reviews.Content: I came here to attend a formal event and this turned out to be a great place to stay. For one thing, it is attached to a mall, so it's easy to run out and buy things your have forgotten. The food was just so-so, ditto for the room. But it was clean and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located at downtown LA, easy access to Metro.”
Reviews.Author: VitoChen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my business trip to LA around Christmas time last year. The location of this hotel is pretty great. Centrally located at downtown area makes it easy to travel to other neighborhoods. For people who drive, there are plenty parking area around, and for people who travel by public transportation, the entrance to Metro is only 4 mins away by walking. The Macy's is within the same building, and there is a food court at B1(along with IHOP and Subway being only 1 block away) it's convenient to have an easy male when ever you want. Besides it's easy-to-get-almost-everywhere location, this is just an a average Sheraton hotel. The facilities are okay, so are the staff. Simply put, I won't personally choose this hotel again if I have other options. ( not that I hate it, I just think other hotels may do a bit better then the staff here in Sheraton downtown.)

Reviews.Title: “My Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Goerge H
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay! They had great rooms, and great staff, especially Jason at the front desk. He was very helpful with us on all of our requests and question. I will definitely recommend my friends and family to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect downtown hotel for businedd”
Reviews.Author: Bellabella907
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and have good size. Staff is very friendly. Many options for drinking or eating nearby. Parking is 32 dollars per day. You need to pay for internet access in your bedroom. Guests are allowed to use the Bally Gim next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for conferences and LA Live”
Reviews.Author: Karolina516
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for the LA Times Travel Show. the conference center is a 10 minute walk, LA Live is a 5 minute walk, the Staples center also. Downtown is not the best location for tourists, but if you do stay here you have some nice options to eat (LA live). The hotel itself was great - the rooms were clean and had everything I needed. The staff was EXTREMELY helpful - I got a suite upgrade, they reserved a great LA tour for me, and by day 2 knew me by name and greeted me in the lobby. The hotel has a bar, restaurant, starbucks, a little store, and is connected to the mall and a Macy's so you can shop without going far ;) The only downside was breakfast - I do not suggest you spend $20pp on a sad buffet. If you do not like noise, ask for a room far from elevator.

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: kim h
Reviews.Content: Let me just say I hated this place before I even checked in. I was traveling for work and needed a place that accepting the Government rate close to the location I would be working in Downtown Los Angeles. I knew when I booked this hotel was attached to the mall, I had no idea it was â€œinâ€� the mall. I was traveling solo and upon arriving to the hotel, there were three huge tour buses parked out front blocking the check in entrance. I was also aware that I would be parking in the mall parking structure after arrival as that is the parking lot the hotel uses. I didnâ€™t bank on the fact I wouldnâ€™t be able to enter into the check-in entrance. I tried driving around the block and call the hotel to see what options I had since their entrance was blocked (mind you, downtown LA, you cannot park or pull over to the side of the road at any time as there are signs everywhere stating such. Not sure why three huge buses were the exception) the phone rang, with no exaggeration for at least three minutes before someone answers. Mind you I am driving, canâ€™t pull over anywhere, holding my phone and trying to maneuver through streets that donâ€™t allow right and/or left hand turns at certain times of the day, not to mention several one way streets. When someone finally answers the phone they ask immediately if I can please hold, of course my response was no I canâ€™t. I asked where I could go to check in since the entrance was still blocked. She told me to park in the parking garage next to the hotel and I could enter that way and it would be easy from the elevator. I do as suggested and pull into the parking garage, park near the elevators and think this isnâ€™t so bad the elevator will take me right there. When I get to the elevator with my luggage, purse and other items from my car, I realize there are no signs as to what floor to get off on. When I get in the elevator there is a button for the bottom floor that says Sheraton. Okay great, this works. As the elevator stops on other floors, there are shoppers, people dressed in gym clothes and I realize that we are stopping in the middle of Macys department store. Did I get on the wrong elevator? Nope, when I get to the bottom floor I get out in the middle of the mall. I get to drag my suitcase through the shopping mall, and as I continue to walk there is a sign as if I am going to a department store that says â€œSheratonâ€� at one of the entrances. Needless to say I am not happy by this point. I check in hiking to myself, just relax it will get better from here. I go to my room and its okay, nothing spectacular, but not too bad. You can definitely tell they tried their best to update the appearance while being in an â€œoldâ€� hotel. It was clean and doable, but definitely been in better. I had picked this location, thinking it was next to the mall it would be safe for me to find places to eat, etc. I am so frustrated I go talk to the manager and nicely explain had it been one thing I could live with my check in issues, but I had real issues with not being able to pull in to check-in and not being able to give the bellman my luggage, having to pull my luggage through a parking garage, through the mall and lastly having them take so long to answer the phone to be told to hold. She graciously offered me dinner, which I was happy with and not expecting. I just wanted her to know tour buses should not be blocking the entrance AND they need to pick up the phone. Anyhow, I used it for dinner in the restaurant, which turned out to be just as horrible as check in. My $30 steak was overcooked, chewy and dry. The bread they served was as hard as a rock. I have had better steaks from Chilis Grill. Anyhow, when I checked out early in the morning a few days later, I had to take my suitcase and walk through the quiet and eerie mall and into the parking garage which just as eerie for that early in the morning. I didnâ€™t like that at all. There are too many other choices to have to stay here again, in fact next time I will pay some out of my pocket and stay at the Omni which is top notch in downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Seattle1313
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge and this was a convenient location, but other than that, there is not much to say. There is no pool, no stunning lobby, the bathroom seemed in desperate need for an upgrade, and the whole room seemed a bit drab except for the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dated Decor”
Reviews.Author: GottaTravel13
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its proximity to LA Live. For the price we paid we were disappointed at how dated the rooms were. The room had a faint smell of old water although the room appeared clean. The beds, dresser and TV were the only furnishings that seemed to be updated in the last decade. The closet had old mirrored doors, the bathroom had a sink faucet from 1980 and overall had a time warp feel. The light switches were dated along with the lamps, phone and alarm clock. This hotel's only saving grace was its modern lobby which includes a restaurant, Starbucks, internet area and a small TV 'living room'. Also, another positive was the free parking across the street at a meter on a Sat night to Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the south-facing rooms, unless you like it hot”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the Sheraton, we turned the A/C all the way to high, went out for three hours, and came back to a room that was still hovering somwehere around Purgatory. The bulilding engineer clocked the temperature on the inside of the south-facing glass at 141 degrees. No wonder the feeble A/C couldn't keep up. Moving to the north side helped quite a bit, but we still needed a table fan to keep air flow at night and to drown out the street sound. Rooms and hallways show their age. On the plus side, the employees are universally well trained and friendly. We have nothing but good things to say on that score. Parking was included in the $119 rate (a special rate for the LA Travel Show), which saved us $28/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AS584
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and was happy we were able to walk around during a conference we were attending downtown. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A good location for downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: SFB
Reviews.Content: As noted in other reviews the rooms are spacious and well furnished. I thought everything was up to date. The staff was friendly and cooperative. The hotel is located close to the Metro system and major bus lines (it is one block from Wilshire Blvd.) I thought the neighborhood was fine. Like much of downtown LA the population thins out at night but there is still some foot traffic. I felt safe walking to some of the plentiful restaurants in the area. Also as noted you are a 10-15 minute walk to LA Live, the Nokia Theater, and the Staples Center. My only issue was the lack of a gym in the hotel. Guests have access to a down-market Bally's located in the attached mall. The facility is a little down at the heels and could use a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as a Sheraton should be”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: They updated the lobby along w/ the rooms, but they didn't touch the bathroom (at least the one we stayed in). It had faucets from the 70s & peeling wallpaper. The exterior of the hotel is dated as it's connected to a Macy's and a small mall. The whole property needs to be renovated as there's not a lot of windows and feels like you're in a bad part of town. Overall location is good, walkable to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Service”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Spend 2 days at this hotel, the employees are outstanding. Victor F at the front desk was like my own personal assistant. The rooms are very nice, the food is excellent and the parking is convenient. The meeting center is perfect for small or large business conferences.

Reviews.Title: “More like a good Holiday Inn but highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Itzyfoxy
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are planning to go to the Staples Center for any events I highly recommend staying in Downtown. The location is great and there is a fare few restaurants and bars to eat drink and dance. Only $6 cab to Staples or 5 minute walk. The Sheraton was a good choice at $190 p/n plus taxes in a really good area. I probably wouldn't pay any more for the reasons mentioned by other reviewers - no pool, no gym, no safe and house keeping is a tad lazy (didn't put iron, ironing board and hair dryer away). There is no free wifi in rooms, only in the lobby. However, the rooms are very spacious and the bed is extremely comfortable. I would compare this stay to a very good Holiday Inn I once stayed in and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Sheraton below Sheraton Standards”
Reviews.Author: zcai
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Sheraton for a week recently, and found that it fell below the normal Sheraton standards. Here is a list of its inadequacies: 1. There is no safe in guest room for storage of valuables; 2. There is not a swimming pool; 3. There is not a convenient self-parking space. Self-parking actually uses the parking space of an adjacent mall. To go to the parking garage, you would have to go down to the ground level of the hotel, walk to the mall, and then take a mall elevator to the fourth floor parking space. Very inconvenient. And they charge $28/day for this; 4. There isn't a gym in hotel. Guests have to use the Bally Total Fitness facility in the adjacent mall; 5. There isn't a second phone in bathroom; and 6. In twin-bed rooms, there is only one small nightstand shared by both beds; The location of the hotel, however, is quite good. It is right in the city center and still close to freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the suites by any means necessary!”
Reviews.Author: Onestepforwards
Reviews.Content: I was offered a free upgrade to a 2-room suite. The clerk actually said, "if you are a light sleeper, you might not like this room, it's near the elevator," but since I'm a solid sleeper, who also travels with a white noise machine, I figured it would be no problem. Oh my goodness, was that ever a horrible mistake. I barely slept that night. The thrumming, clanking, machinery noises switched on and off irregularly all night. Every time I got used to them, the pattern changed. The white noise machine was no help since the vibrations went right through the floors and wall, it wasn't just a noise you could block out. I finally got to sleep very late, then was startled awake at 3 am. I thought about getting up, repacking everything and moving rooms, but it was already so late and I had a big presentation the next day! It was easily the worst night of sleep I have had in a hotel since I stayed in an un-air- conditioned Howard Johnson's in 1992. The next day when I went to switch rooms they didn't seem surprised at all. . . I don't know who could sleep in those suite rooms. A homeless person accustomed to sleeping under a noisy bridge? Someone taking Ambien who is thus completely drugged out of their mind? Someone who drank about 40 martinis and then passed out? If none of these descriptors apply to you, then avoid those suites. The regular room I switched to was fine, no complaints. Relief! They should convert the elevator-shaft suites into broom closets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown LA!!”
Reviews.Author: Jose G
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton hotel was a great hotel to stay at. My wife and I had a lot of fun and plan on coming back next year. The hotel is close to the staples center and convention center, so watching a game there or any event is an easy 15 minute walk. What I love about this hotel is that it's so close to the freeway (in a quiet sense), and there's public transportation all around the hotel, easy accessabile for anyone looking to go to Hollywood and other major attractions. A special thank you goes out to Jason at the front desk from my wife and I. We appreciated his extended kindness and extra mile he went for upgrading us to a good room. He made our stay more enjoyable after a recommendation he gave us for a resteraunt in Long Beach and a connection he had with the manager to get us a beautiful city view on a last minute notice. Another good factor about this hotel is the free internet and printing services they have in the lobby, great for printing out my boarding pass. We had a corner room and what's nice about these corner rooms is the type of view it has on a 3-D angle, but you have to be pretty high up to get a decent view. It's true what other reviews are saying about their beds, they are so soft and lovely. We are actually thinking of purchasing one ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Downtown”
Reviews.Author: isumi1175
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located downtown, within a small shopping mall anchored by Macy's Express. Gustavo at the reception made check-in fast and pleasant. The room was spacious, well-appointed. Elevators were busy and a bit slow. Although it is within a block of a Metro station, it is more likely that you have arrived at the hotel with a car as we did. The parking situation was confusing when we read up ahead of our arrival. Public parking at Pershing Square is a good 7 minutes walk away, inconvenient and not recommended. Do not park on the street, since a ticket will cost more than daily parking rates. If you bring your car and do not plan to use until you leave, park at a lot across the street on Hope for $5 all day. If you plan to use your car frequently during your stay, the rate of $28 a day with in and out privilege in the garage above Macy's, next to Sheraton, is reasonable, compared to $38 at some hotels nearby. Entrance to this garage is on either Flower or Hope and be prepared to drive roller-coaster style to the 4th floor to park. Valet parking is also available, at $32 daily, including the inconvenience of waiting for car delivery at the Hope entrance. We were pleased with our stay at Sheraton Downtown, and plan to return in the future. If you stay here, please do plan to go to Bottega Louie, a gourmet patisserie and restaurant one block away on W 7th St and Grand for memorable breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chic84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in order to attend a friend's wedding. I booked a double room but they were able to give me a king size bed room when I arrived. I had to rely on public transportation since I don't drive and this hotel is right across the street from the metro. It is also across the street from Walgreens and CVS (or was it Rite Aid?) so picking up nick knacks was easy. I liked my room on the 9th floor but it can get noisy out in the hall way. I would hear people walking back and forth and workers wheeling things. I ordered room service one night and find it to be a bit expensive but my salad was delicious. It was nice that they have computer free for use in the lobby for up to 45 minute intervals. That allowed me to check my email quickly without having to pay for wifi. I ventured out to the mall next to the hotel and found this beauty store down stairs. I got my brows waxed there for $7.5 and thought that price is not bad, but she almost freaked me out because she took 30 minutes doing it and she had to find her glasses mid-way. My brows turned out great but the time she spent and the whole experience did get me worried. All the staff that I came across (check-in staff, room service person and delivery staff, staff that I see in the hall) were all courteous and looked willing to help. I liked my stay here and wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perth WA”
Reviews.Author: Carol P
Reviews.Content: Brilliant thankyou Gustavano you made our stay memorable. All the best and I recommend this hotel to all as the location is great and the service was wonderful. The beds were fab.

Reviews.Title: “The are better choices available.”
Reviews.Author: michgtan
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the hotel. The general condition was old and run down. Thankfully we only stayed two nights and were out 90% of the time. Really there are newer, better maintained choices. Check them out first.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown good service”
Reviews.Author: londoner_cb
Reviews.Content: We stopped off at the Sheraton Downtown after flying in from London. Booked in on the preferred guest club floor. We had very good service form all staff members, from the valet - you drive down from the sweep in drive to the carpark, where there is a large area to stop unload and let them organise the bellhop and valet the car. All very organised. Desk staff pleasant and efficient - offering us an upgrade but letting us know it would be near the liftshaft - fine, do for 1 night we declined. Room was fine. Sure not a modern swish one but large and with good essentials. Bed was v comfortable. Bathroom fine, again against one that is newly done it looks old, but all worked fine and I don't see a problem. Only thing that should get urgent attention was the aircon unit because it couldn't be turned off properly - and a mechanical rattle continued through the night. Too tired to call down about it, and it was late anyway. Did note it on the comments put in though. Club room is small but good breakfast items available - fruit bowl, cereals, toaster, pastries etc etc, and again pleasant efficient staff. The bar downstairs in the foyer did a good job of watering and feeding us in the evening with choice of TV showing sport, and on this night Dancing With The Stars. Good service here as well, and basic but well prepared food. Good business hotel or for anyone needing a place in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrHyphen
Reviews.Content: Located across from the 7th Street Metro, this is very convenient. In a good location of town where you feel relatively safe walking around this hotel is attached to the Macys plaza. I did not eat at the hotel as there were lots of good eats nearby and for breakfast the food court in the plaza had options. Had great service and the maid got to know that I perferred extra regular coffee (Starbucks) for the in room coffee maker. One day she even dropped off fridge with no charge. Took advantage of the lobby bar drink special on Friday. Lobby is actually in the basement but there is escalators. Parking nearby if you need it can be had for the cheap in outside lots. Got a $101 nightly rate through Expedia but the hotel still honoured my Starwood membership with slightly upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Less
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel as I hadn't stayed in downtown L.A. in years but this hotel turned out be a a very good choice for my needs. Located just across the street from the subway and a few blocks from both the convention center and Staples center it's a great choice for those staying in L.A. on business or for pleasure. If you forgot to bring something on your trip then just walk across the street to either the Rite-Aid or Walgreens to pick up what you need. In addition to the drugstores mentioned above the hotel is connected to a small shopping center anchored by Macy's with a few other shops as well as a small food court. There are also plenty of restaurants from those in the hotel or within a short walk from the hotel to suit just about any palate. Because this is in downtown L.A. it is a more business oriented area and is far less crowded with fewer places open on the weekends. Overall the hotel was very good with a friendly staff and a comfortable room at a reasonable price-especially for California.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rehman23
Reviews.Content: Dumb reception staff. Tidy rooms. Excellent room service. Good food. Helpful people!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Downtown ... But Not Much Else”
Reviews.Author: khg2010
Reviews.Content: If you've got business in downtown Los Angeles or are planning on visiting the Staples Center, the Sheraton is very convenient. Walking almost anywhere from the symphony to the contemporary art museum, is easy and pleasant enough. The hotel sits on top of a Macy's shopping center with a Bally's fitness gym that hotel guests can use for free any time. Seeing the rest of L.A. is tricky, since it's so spread out, but there is a metro stop at the corner near the hotel. Having a car would make getting around easier, but parking is expensive. The hotel was clean enough the the room was large, but there were little things that made the stay less than perfect. Unused outlets for charging electronics -- a must for business travelers -- were hard to find. Wi-fi was free for me, but the clerk had to make sure of that when I checked in, so it seems that wi-fi is not always free. It depends on what deals are available when you make your reservation. There is no included breakfast, but there are plenty of coffee shops nearby. There's a lounge and restaurant on-site that are no more expensive than anyplace nearby if you're too exhausted to search for other options and just want a quick and easy dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreLamb
Reviews.Content: The downtown Sheraton was very nice, the lobby is very luxurious and my room was on the 17th floor with a fabulous view of the city. The bed was soft and comfy, and the bathroom lined with marble. It was convenient to restaurants, LA LIve and USC events. The daily parking fee is pretty high, so figure that in.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL RECEPTION FOR A FIRST TIMER”
Reviews.Author: Sindy10stone
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel on the afternoon of the 23rd of October 2011. I was immediately given a free upgrade wow. The reception is friendlly and very helpful. Many thanks to Anne on Reception and Chrystal in the Bar. I love the momento shop and the sweet milky coffees. I love my bed so the Sheraton Beds were a dream come true for me. I enjoyed every minute.It was excellent value for money and I will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: S G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night. The associate at the front desk (Gustavo Gomez) was very helpful and upgraded our room due to our Starwood Preferred Guest status. The hotel was clean, the staff very friendly, and prices fair (well... comparable to everything else). You can work out at the Bally's across the way, which was a nice little bonus for being a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very average”
Reviews.Author: window_seat0
Reviews.Content: I have to disagree with the recent "5 out of 5" rating reviews. This hotel is in dire need of renovations. The lobby decor and layout is stuck in the 80's and so are the rooms. The lobby bar is quite depressing. The Starbucks , also in the underground lobby (no natural light int he lobby) also doubles as the sundries store, so nail polish is side by side with your morning latte. The overcrowded workout facility is located in an adjacent underground mall. I was offered an "upgraded" room at check-in. Luckily the front desk clerk told me these rooms were adjacent tot he elevators. They actually wrap around the elevators at each level. I would avoid them if you like to sleep. Although the front desk staff was pleasant, I was shocked to have a note from the Director of Guest Services slipped under my door stating : "If you receive a Guest Survey, emailed following departure, we appreciate you scoring us 10 for Overall Satisfaction!" (sic) This sort of request I expect from car dealerships, and is really unfit of a chain like Starwood. Don't tell me what you expect me to score you. Asking for a "10" because you "worked hard to achieve this goal"? I'll be the judge of that, thank you very much. The breakfast selection was seriously limited on the club level. The A/C was deficient in the room, with the temperature pushed to it's lowest set point with the room still way too stuffy. Housekeeping barged into my room at 8:45... two days in a row. My "Overall Satisfaction Score"? A solid 5.5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Lidia M
Reviews.Content: We had the best time, large clean rooms, excellent service, friendly staff, conveniently located for business and entertainment. Overall one the best experiences during our vacation! We highly recommend this Sheraton to anyone looking for a centrally located Hotel in Los Angeles California. Whether youâ€™re here for business, entertainment, dinning, taking your family to Disneyland, Universal Studios or near by beaches. There are lots of great restaurants in the area and if you donâ€™t feel like driving, the underground Metro is right across the street! Treat yourself to the bestâ€¦youâ€™ll be glad you did! Weâ€™ll definitely be back! Mr & Mrs Mackie

Reviews.Title: “Best in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Victor C
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Downtown Los Angeles is the best you can obtain in the area for pricing, quality and customer satisfaction. I have known this hotel for three years and I am impressed whith the incredible customer service that I have always obtained from Maricore who is always available to take my phone calls at the front desk, to make reservations, make suggestions and to answer any type of concerns. She is always on top of everything and makes things very simple for me as a traveler who is always in a rush. The whole staff is great but ask for Maricore! Rooms are spacious which makes your stay very confortable, beds are also great. It is hard to obtain large and confortable rooms these days at competitive prices like this hotel. Overall this is a great choice to anyone planning to stay specially for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for LA convention, LA Live!”
Reviews.Author: erhof
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at downtown Sheraton for a conference in LA convention. Although the hotel lobby is not the most up to date, the room was very comfortable, well appointed and quiet, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were friendly and accommodating. The club on the concierge floor had a basic but tasty hors d'oeuvres selection, with wine and beer for a fee. The hotel is directly connected to a mini-mall with Macy's, health club and other shops. It was a 15 min walk to the convention. Lots of restaurants a short cab ride or walk away. To save on the $50 cab ride from the airport, I took the flyaway bus to union station for $7 just outside baggage claim, walked through the station and got a $12 cab to the hotel. Turned out to be pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “Very Starwood Elite Friendly; Finding Hertz not Easy”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: We were here for a convention at the convention center. We arrived very early ( 10:30 AM), but not only did they have a room available, it was an upgrade to a very nice full suite, complete with 2 full baths and 2 flat screen TVs. Beds were very comfortable and shower power was great. Amenities were standard Sheraton & there was an in-room coffee maker. Odd thermostats (no numbers just + or -) but we were able to keep room comfortable on the 2 October days we were there. The Club Lounge and its offerings were a bit minimal and dated, but we were told they were in the process of moving to a new, better lounge and updating their offerings. WI-FI was good & free for Starwood Platinums. We brought back our Hertz car to the Hertz location in the lower level of hotel. This was handy but very poorly markedâ€¦.we kept having to ask staff where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, service a bit off this time”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here in the past, and enjoyed speedy, attentive service as a SPG even though we were using airline points for the stay. The room was clean, spacious, & quiet. The king bed had top quality linens and was very comfortable. Temperature was comfortable despite a quirky thermostat which only allows you to control more or less and doesn't show degrees. Hotel is connected to shopping mall with Macy's. Not so good - slow check in, & bell hop service. Free internet is only downstairs. Valet parking is downstairs. Sink faucets were a bit sticky and oddly placed at angles to the spigot. There is also a Starbucks downstairs but there is a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Allys444
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean, and quiet. The location was even nicer; being attached to a shopping mall gives a person (especially one staying alone) many options for eating and shopping without having to travel far.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: ezilla5
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a week, mostly for a bachelor party, but also to see downtown LA. My trip was divided in half by the party, so I had two difference rooms. The front desk staff was perfect, put me in ultra-clean rooms with nice views both times. They were professional and polite, as was the valet staff. I recommend the Sheraton to anyone who needs a great location downtown and excellent world traveler service. I've been all over the place and the staff here was as good as anywhere I've been. Also, incredibly comfortable beds and pillows. Thank you, Sheraton. I wish I could live there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atamel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice for a conference and I think the hotel is very good. Rooms are clean and spacious, staff are very helpful and quick, location is pretty good (not far from Nokia Center and Convention Center). I also enjoyed their breakfast every day for 4 days in a row. There's nothing spectacular about this hotel but nothing bad either, just what you expect.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HollandHeights
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great customer service. Quick, friendly, and knowledgeable of the area. The rooms are very clean, the beds are very comfortable, and you get two sets of pillows, foam and feather. The price of the food is comparable. The hotel is also connected directly to a mall. You don't have to go outside to shop. I was here for a conference. There may be free internet access, but I think it depends on your room rate. I got a discounted rate, so I had to pay $12.95 for internet access, which is comparable to other hotels in the area. There is a gym the hotel uses, and guests get in free. There are treadmills, bikes, weights of all kinds (free and machine), and I do think they have yoga classes available. You didn't have to wait for the equipment, there is lots of it. No swimming pool, however. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Employee Compliment”
Reviews.Author: Larry D
Reviews.Content: We had a very short stay at the hotel, however it was very enjoyable. The hotel staff was excellent. I would like to commend one of the desk personnel whose name is GUSTAVO GOMEZ. His courtesy and happy personality was enjoyable. When we needed directions and or restaurant names he quickly supplied them. Because of the staff's demeanor and the fine facility we will stay at this hotel whenever we are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here again”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a five night stay in LA but left after two as the rooms were well below standard for what you expect from a name like Sheraton(or even a comfort inn). The first room we had was dirty and smelt of smoke (despite a leaflet saying you'll be fined for smoking in the room so they can professionally clean/febreeze it properly), this was a preferred guest room, so we went back to reception and got upgraded to a club room. The problem with this hotel is the rooms are dated and in need of a make-over. I can imagine that in the 70's this was a very nice hotel to stay in. When you walk into the room you are greeted by dirty ceiling tiles and a loud, dusty, overworked air-con. The bathroom is basic and what i'd expect from a motel, and though not dirty it didn't feel clean as it was old and shabby. Paint was chipped and wallpaper peeling from the walls. I didn't like to walk around on the carpet as it felt grubby. I didn't even un-pack in the hotel as I didn't feel comfortable or like I could relax. The club room was ok, but i've been in better, again it is in need of modernising. I can't really fault the staff as they were OK, I think they know how bad the rooms are as they didn't argue with me. My only complaint about them is that i've read other reviews about rooms that have been renovated. I didn't know this at the time of asking but I did specifically ask for a renovated room after the first one as there is nothing else really wrong with this hotel apart from the age of the rooms. If they invested some money in the rooms then I think my stay would have been very enjoyable, but as it stands I hated every second of my stay there and I think the fact I left early speaks volumes. If you are a tourist stay in Hollywood or Beverley Hills as I could have put up with the grubby room if there was somewhere decent to go outside, if you're on business in Downtown then I would recommend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not awful; good location”
Reviews.Author: rgam
Reviews.Content: Stay was for business (large event). Walking into the lobby I thought, "this looks nice, it won't be too bad for a few nights." The lobby and elevators were the nicest part of the hotel. Staff was polite, but not a warm welcome like you get at other SPG hotels. The room I stayed in was on the SPG floor and I would have assumed it would be nicer than others. I was wrong. The thermostat was near impossible to 'fine tune,' the bathroom was not very clean (not to mention extremely dated), and the towels were a bit threadbare. Internet access is an extra charge per day. This was not an awful hotel, but just average and in need of a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: thrillsteven
Reviews.Content: I styed at the Hotel while taping an episode of Judge Judy. The hotel paid for the stay so this may be bias. I found the hotel excelent. They Only complaint was when I came back from the taping around 4pm and my room had not been made up. It was a stressful day and I just wanted to sleep. I called down and the problem was resolved while I walked to the RidAid across the street. Very good would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service at my Event”
Reviews.Author: Lilian J
Reviews.Content: My company had a dinner/meeting with very important clients in August. I was incharge of setting up marketing packets, promotional items, and all signage, so I arrived an hour before the event. When I arrived Manuel Cazares the Banquet Captain immediately introduced himself and escorted me to the ballroom. He let me know everything was ready on their end and asked if I needed help. I requested easels, help with hanging signs, and setting up the marketing materials. Manuel delegated the tasks and within minutes everything was done. I had a few more special requests and he and his staff assisted me with each. Manuel and his staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a successful event. I was extremely satisfied with the service I was provided and have had a couple more events at this Sheraton since. If you want to have a great event I would highly recommend this hotel for special events. I also highly recommend Manuel Cazares, Banquet Captain, along with his team. I can reassure you that they will provide you with exceptional service!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Diana s
Reviews.Content: This experience takes the cake. Filthy room, chairs so disgusting I had to put towels over the seats. Speaking of towels, they are ripped and frayed. The staff is rude who respond inappropriately. The wake-up call was broken, when I called them the response was " its automated." (!?). Plastic cups, old telephones, this place is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: pdx-engaged
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, typical sheraton. Walls are very thin, heard the neighbors til all hours. Nothing special. Over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “It served its purpose . . .”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGyrl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here because I was attending a two-day seminar being held at the hotel. It served its purpose . . . PLUSES: -Price was fairly reasonable for downtown LA (used AAA discount; no discount relating to seminar, but I assume that is the fault of the seminar provider, not the hotel). -SUPER friendly service from all the staff that I encountered. -Clean rooms. -In my situation, location was convenient since the seminar was there. -Good location in terms of being on the edge of downtown LA, such that there was no traffic within downtown to get to the hotel once you get off the freeway into downtown (and super easy to find). MINUSES: -Really bad cellphone reception (even for smartphone 3G networks), ESPECIALLY on the conference floor (i.e., basement), which I had no reception at all and had to turn off my cellphone to prevent the battery from draining. -My room was pretty outdated and could use a renovation. -Parking is over $30. -WiFi is not free. OTHER: -Adjacent to a shopping mall, which could be a good thing or a bad thing, depending on who you are! The crowd seemed to be a combination of business people and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra G
Reviews.Content: Your associate Estela Estrada was such a wonderful help during my stay at your hotel. I hope to see her next time I am in your hotel. Thank You for hiring responsible, caring, courteous people in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: late_bloomer09
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a concert so we specifically wanted a hotel near the Staples Center/LA Live. Great stay for location and rateâ€¦..Modern lobby with huge lounge area and plenty of seating with cocktail tables for business travelers. Clean spacious room, very comfy beds. Very friendly and accommodating staffâ€¦.Stay includes access to Ballyâ€™s Fitness which is connected to Hotel in Macyâ€™s Shopping Center. You trade filtered water for full-service gym with plenty of aerobic machines and access to Ballys Fitness Classes <not a bad trade-off> Again, connected to Macyâ€™s Shopping Center which includes Express, Victoria Secrets, Bath & Body and other mall chain shops. Walking distance from LA Live and Staples Center; and the Grammys Museum which I would highly recommend for music lovers. We dined at Rock & Fish and The Farm in LA Live, both 2 thumbs up. The Farm was absolutely delightful! I would recommend reservations for dinner at the restaurants in LA Live if they are having any performances/shows at the Staples Center during your stay <we learned that the hard way-:)> Parking at the hotel is $28/night (ouch!). However, we found a few lots nearby that were much more affordable. Aside from that, great stay, would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: BabaDas
Reviews.Content: (This is an open letter to Ian Gee the General Manager of the Sheraton Hotel Downtown in Los Angeles.) This is my 11th consecutive year as a Starwood Platinum Member and in all that time I have only been inspired on three other occasions to write a review of a property. Therefore I am honored to write this review to make known my gratefulness for you're Staff providing such an exceptional experience at my recent stay at your Property. I had the opportunity to thank Maricora earlier for her role in providing exceptional service upon check-in. I appreciated your Team's hospitality, the room upgrade's, the early check-in, the late check-out, and the overall warmth and personal care your property extended to my Guest's and I.Â  To my Peer's here on Trip Advisor please know that when your travel calls for you to be in Downtown Los Angeles don't spend hundred of dollars a night to stay in some over-rated property! The Sheraton is inexpensive, (I booked my nights for only $159 a night and about $200 less then some of the other swanky hotels that don't come close to offering the warmth, charm, and value I found here at this property!) For those with access to it the Concierge Lounge was excellent! A perfect place to unwind and get some work done with free refreshments and scrumptious appetizers. The location is perfect! Close to everything! The property is clean and warm and very cheerful. Every staff member that I encountered was authentically concerned about our comfort and enjoyment. They really want to make sure your experience is memorable. We took advantage of ordering some room service and were completely satisfied. The food arrived hot and tasty! In under 20 minutes!!! The hotel was immaculate and felt very cozy. The beds were a dream! (pun intended) The rooms were clean as a whistle and the bathroom was luxurious! I have informed Daniel Kerzner as he is the Director of the Starwood Ambassador Program and He should know I recommend he send his VIP Guests to stay under your care. I have also shared my gratitude with Tanja at Starwood Corporate as she is my Personal Travel Ambassador and her Manager, Laurie McBeath. They ask me to provide details whenever I encounter a truly exceptional experience that goes above and beyond the normal high standards Starwood sets for it's guests and you are without question the example they had in mind. Â In the words of one of your most famous Govenors, "I'll be back"! My finest and best regards, Mitch

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with GREAT service.”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a corner room because they did not have a room ready after 4:00pm. The service was great BTW, Location was close to good restaurants, and there is a Ralph's 2 blocks away I like beiing able to walk to restaurants and shopping. Only negative, was the hall carpeting need replaced on the 16th floor..

Reviews.Title: “great personnel”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: Had to find a hotel for my daughter and her friend to stay at that was in a good and safe location. I found the Sheraton on line, called and talked to a wonderful gentlemen that took care of everything. Daughter said that the genlemen stayed at work until they arrived and made sure that they had everything they would need and told them about sights to see the next day and bus services. In this day and age it good to find this kind of service.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk is Amazing! Jason Reyes is the "go to guy"!”
Reviews.Author: Katlin E
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel pretty late and was afraid that I wasnâ€™t going to be able to get a good choice in a room, since the staff was warning me prior to my arrival when I was calling that they were sold out and request would be based on a first come first serve. Ok, no problem; completely understood. When I finally arrived at the hotel, there was a long line and I was all the way in the back of the line, at this point all I wanted to do was get to sleep for my long day I had plan ahead. While waiting in line, a young gentleman come out from the back to the front desk, saw the line and really did something that impressed me! Instead of saying â€œnextâ€�, he called out â€œDo I have any SPG members in line? I can assist them on this side pleaseâ€�â€¦â€¦..turns out, I was the only SPG member in line and so I was able to cut from the back to front, nice! His name was Jason Reyes; he was one of the managers. I asked Jason, for a high floor with a complimentary upgrade, but as the previous staff member warned me over the phone of the hotel being sold out, Jason had confirmed at check in. I was not being picky at all, and took the room on the 17th floor, but what really surprised me was how Jason said to me â€œif you would like, tomorrow when I come into work I can move your rooms to a higher floor with a corner room?â€� I said to him â€œoh no, I wouldnâ€™t want to put you through that troubleâ€�, but he was so kind and charming to say â€œNot at all, this will be my first priority to my shift tomorrow eveningâ€�. Yes and he kept his word, the next day I was moved to a higher floor with a beautiful corner room view. The beds in the room are so lovely, I honestly am in the process of purchasing a mattress like the ones they have. Throughout my stay I encountered Jason standing at the door directing his staff and being very accommodating with others in the lobby, very fine management here! Another gentleman I would like to point out is Larry at the bellman desk. He always had a smile on him and made me feel good with approaching him on questions about the area. Larry loved to chuckle, walk around and interact with others. Now about the amenities of the hotel. Parking is really, really expensive but there is a small lot across the street that charges you like $5 or $6 each time you leave, so I would recommend parking across the street and just taking the train to attractions in the area since itâ€™s so close. If your looking to stay somewhere for fun and be near attractions, I recommend this hotel and the two staff members above. The hotel is near the Staples center and there are a lot of restaurants in the area, walking distance. If your looking to go to Hollywood, the train is right across the street and will save you gas money, traffic time and is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: wanderluststruck
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 22nd floor. It was a wheelchair access room so it was awkward as there was no bathroom door, just a sliding door that wouldn't close completely (there was no handle on the door so we just pulled it as far as we could). That was a minor detail compared to the beautiful view, the comfy king-size bed and the upgrade that gave us access to the Club Lounge (including free water bottles & soda which helped in the summer heat, complimentary breakfast and hors d'oeuvres every afternoon). The only other negative thing about the room is that it was right next to the service elevators, so it's not conducive to sleeping in, as the door leading to the elevators gets slammed every few minutes starting in the early morning. But on the other hand, because it's a corner room, there are no side neighbors and you can make noise and not feel bad. There is wifi access in the lobby, although it would be nice for it to be available throughout the hotel. The location is great, close to the metro system and there's a great grocery store a block away (Ralph's). There's also a Starbucks in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall, a great experience. I booked on hotwire and paid approx $272 for 3 nights, so it was definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful attention!”
Reviews.Author: melissa02842
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Hotel, I was given a room on the 11th floor. I need antivet drugs to travel, so I did not notice until the next day that the elevator gave me vertigo. The staff moved us immediately to a lower floor and accommodated me each time I needed to come and go because I needed to use the stairs. The staff was exceptionally nice and I never really had to wait very long for someone to get me up the stairs to my new room. I give them an A+ for being so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Older, Reasonably comfortable, some annoyances that made it a so-so stay”
Reviews.Author: MaduroJim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton LA Downtown for a conference, arriving on a Sunday, leaving on a Thursday. There are some great plusses here - location in general was great, and it's connected to a little mall with a food court, so you do have options beside room service and the hotel restaurant. The rooms have been updated, but not fully remodeled,so you have new bedding, furniture and a flat-panel TV, but the bathroom and room controls are original. The bed was comfortable, Internet services worked OK (not blazing speed), but there were a couple of annoyances that brought the rating down. TV services were horrible - close to half the channels weren't available and the front desk said "yeah, they're planning an upgrade". The other issue was telephone services - getting a wake-up call took at least 2 tries most nights with the phone ringing over 20 times. A colleague who didn't have my cell but knew what hotel I was at had to call 4 times to reach an operator and get put through to the room. Bottom line - if you're looking to be downtown and gotta have your Starwood points, it's an OK stay, but it didn't wow me.

Reviews.Title: “Discount room shows it's age”
Reviews.Author: SunnyvaleMOm9
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted prepaid rate for a standard room at the Sheraton. We were put in a fourth floor room. Room seemed nice enough but had an exposed overhead unfinished fixture in the bathroom. Beds were the super comfortable 'heavenly bed' you can expect at any Sheraton/Westin. Armchair in the room had stains on it. We asked if anything else was available, but several business meetings were going on that weekend so the front desk indicated the only alternative was a room on the club floor but next to the service elevator. Pros - guests have free access to the Bally's fitness next door and many great restaurants in walking distance. Parking for this hotel is a ripoff at $26/day in the shared shopping mall parking. Later we saw all day parking available at $8/day across the street! Room service for breakfast provided an extremely overcooked omelet. Missing amenities were quickly provided by housekeeping upon request (shower cap, extra toiletries and towels).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pisces219
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. The staff were all really friendly and upon check in we were upgraded which was nice! The front desk staff even gave us good restaurant recommendations! There is a restaurant in the hotel but we didn't eat there. We did grab a few drinks at the lobby bar which was nicely decorated in an art-deco sort of way. The hotel is attached to Macy's which is a plus; you have everything right there! You also have free access to Bally Total Fitness while a guest at the Sheraton. The room was a Deluxe and we had a pretty nice view of downtown as we were on the 22nd floor. The room was spotless, clean and stocked with soap, mouthwash, shampoo etc! There is also a gift shop and starbucks in the hotel! We really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again. Sheraton is a good name so we didn't expect anything less or listen to too many of the bad reviews! The bed was so comfortable too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: coachleech
Reviews.Content: Today was a crazy crowded day but when my room wasn't ready I waited and then was upgraded to the club floor and a deluxe room! When we went in to the Club room for a snack it was 6:00 pm and nothing was set up. Using the phone in the room, we called down and with in 5 minutes Gustavo came in and got everyone drinks then went and got a nice display of fruit, cheese, vegetables and dips. He set it up quickly and efficiently and had to back fill the entire set up. He was so attentive to everyone in the room, clearing tables, getting ice and chilled glasses. I felt very pampered by Gustavo and after a long drive in traffic it was just what I needed!

Reviews.Title: “Able at front desk is fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gapaholic
Reviews.Content: Able at the front desk was amazing from the first phone call to check out. Minnie Sanders in Club Lounge was fanatstic and sergio was good. Staff in Terrace always helpul, Manuel, Jose and Rudy. The housekeeping was not up to par(ran out of tp, didnt replace water daily and failed to replace tolietries) 23rd floor is the way to go!! Includes access to Lounge and Minnie:) Parking was a bit high but its downtown. Had a run in with Ingrid but felt that manager Jose Reyes was on top of things.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: fincoop
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is right downtown in LA, corner of 7th and S. Hope Sts. The hotel is attached to a Macy's shopping center, and the parking garage is here also. If you park a car, you will need to walk 5 minutes (indoors) across the mall to your car. Self park is also $28 per day. Valet is also offered for $32. So, while that is a down side, especially with kids, the upside is all of the amenities the mall offers without having to go outdoors. There is a small supermarket where we bought fresh fruit. Another vendor sold smoothies for breakfast. There is a Carl's Jr. if you feel like a burger. So in this sense the Sheraton has more to offer than most other hotels if you count what is in the mall as hotel amenities. Room decor is Westin-esque with dark wood, white bedding, the usual heavenly stuff. Wireless and wired Internet worked well, offered through AT&T for a fee. We had an infant with us and requested a crib, and the hotel obliged. Housekeeping even made up the crib each day, which was a nice touch. When I complained about the A/C not working well, a technician came by to confirm and then ordered me a fan for my room to help circulate the air, which helped. This was my first time in LA so it was tough to benchmark against other hotels, but I wasn't really impressed with the Sheraton. It was nice, just not life-altering in any way. I also found as a tourist, you have to get at least 5 miles from the hotel to do anything, so downtown is not a location I would recommend for tourists, it's also expensive to sleep and park here.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: RIBROWN
Reviews.Content: When we asked how we could use the pool at Bally's the Concierge told us to get towels at the desk and go across the short hall with our keys to Bally's and we could use their pool. NOT SO, there is no pool at Bally's and the people at Bally's laughed at us for trying. By the way, the Concierge's Desk is within site of Bally's! Doorman and Desk people were great! Room OK

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Jahlov
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at the Sheraton Los Angeles was just ok. Although the hotel was very close the metro, I was not aware that it was under a Macy's mall thereby making it accessible to undesirables that can enter the hotel at anytime. I was approached by someone for money and that made me uneasy as I had my child with me. The downtown area has a lotto be desired and the hotel reflects that. It needs a general overall of the fixtures,carpet and rooms. I have stayed at much better Sheratons. I was happy with the Sheraton link which was convenient and the restaurant was good however it was pricy. The best part visit was the customer service. Everybody was very accommodating and it was definitely a plus to have access to the Bally's next door. As this was my first visit to LA, we made the best of it and had a ball however, I will not stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kungfuchef
Reviews.Content: My Wife and most our her family stayed here in late May 2011. Had a wedding block for my brother in law's wedding and we had a wonderful stay. The hotel was very nice, very clean, and the food in the restaurant was great. Lynda at the Front desk was very helpful and made coordinating our groups needs easy. We'll Definately be back the next time we're in LA.

Reviews.Title: “One associate at the hotel was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Harry2357
Reviews.Content: Gustavo, the desk clerk was fabulous. He was very courteous, knowledgable and had good suggestions for us. We were new to the Sheraton system and Gustavo was very patient to explain all of our options. He was knowlegable about options for restaurants in the neighborhood. We were unfamiliar with the streets in the area and Gustavo found us a map and explained about the freeway access that we needed. Gustavo took very good care of us and made sure all our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “We hold our meetings here...”
Reviews.Author: Lmiller31310
Reviews.Content: .....about every 3 months and my company continues to go back. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. I 'd like to send a shout out to Roberto Hdez in Banquet who graciously helped me get organized and clean up after my meeting Day 1. Then he came back to help me at the end of day 2 when I was trying to rush out and catch a flight. He made my clean up easier and was a huge help with making sure my boxes got out to the Fedex pickup. Thank you Sheraton, see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “good location for downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: skp5280
Reviews.Content: front desk staff very helpful and courteous. The lobby area is nice, they have 3-4 computers for internet use to hotel guests. Good location, close to major companies in downtown, my office was only 2 blocks away. The mall attached to the hotel closes early. The rooms are acceptable, but the hallways can use a face lift. Overall good location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service during busy times”
Reviews.Author: Stefan095
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say "hats off" to the staff at Sheraton Downtown. I've stayed here a few times the last 10 years and this time during the busy E3 show and I was very impressed with their high service level. I've travel a lot all over the world and this was probably one of my best stays so far 2011. Everything I asked for was arranged with a smile. Taxi's, luggage, breakfast, laundry and extended check-out (spg gold) I can highly recommend the Sheraton downtown, thank you Victor, Lyndia H, Edgar M and the rest of the team. Stefan ( from London)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, but not perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night with an upgrade to a corner room like on the tripadvisor room pics. In the evening, the views were fantastic but the windows very dirty. It's a plus that you can open them, but the building is a bit old - very loud noise from the street despite being on one of the highest floors. Also, a doorman lost our bag from the way to the room from our car using valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you like Macy's”
Reviews.Author: mary92651
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is within the Macy's Center which was a surprise to find a hotel in a shopping mall. I was told there is a fitness center, but in fact rather than a hotel facility it is a Bally's fitness within the mall. The hotel charges for internet, but there are free computers and printer in the lobby which was helpful in printing out theatre tickets etc. Great location for walking to the music center, MOCA, central libray and many restaurantes nearby. The room was upgraded to a suite, nice view out to the L.A. Live area of town. Basically a very good hotel for a reasonable price found on their website. Less than other travel sites. AAA discount took significant amount off price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: mrnngg
Reviews.Content: This was a splendid hotel and it provided all the necessary amenities. For instance, free WIFI in lobby is huge and the link @ sheraton experience was phonomenal. Very close to a metro station which makes it very easy to commute and in the heart of downtown right by all the necessities wallgreens, etc. I managed to snag this on priceline so I got a terrific rate and also early check in. Room was cozy a tad cold but did what I would expect for what I paid. No complaints, very very happy. I've discovered a secret to a decent room.... Say.. I am very sensitive to noise so would I be able to get a hotel room higher up? This eliminates all noise issues.. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate with great staff”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a week long stay in LA where I also spent nights in the W Hollywood and the SLS Beverly hills. The SLS is a beautiful hotel, but for my final 2 nights I was mainly going to be working, and I didn't see the point of spending $600 a night on a suite when all was going to be doing was sitting behind the desk. So I decamped to the much cheaper Sheraton Downtown. And what can I say? I really was very happy there. It's a mid tier Sheraton, not the newest but not the oldest either, and the area of downtown is actually pretty OK with Macys, Starbucks, Walgreens all very close. Everything you need. I also really liked Octopus (sushi restaurant opposite) which served pretty decent sushi that was also, like the hotel, great value. Top marks go the staff who were superbly friendly both on the front desk and around the hotel, exceptionally so in fact - it was them that made me decide to write this review. One negative is that the hotel does not have it's own gym - instead you sign into the Bally gym in the shopping arcade. The distance is not a problem but the gym is fairly horrible, a fairly old 1980s style place. So if you do like a nice private hotel gym, you'll miss that here. So in summary, it's not somewhere I'd bring a date to impress and won't be on my top 10 list of hotels, but for a solid Sheraton to kill a few days working in LA in, it did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location, horrible parking”
Reviews.Author: perryinvancouver
Reviews.Content: The hotel definitely deserves all the bad reviews it receives. Before booking I saw the many, many bad reviews but I also saw a really great deal - well, you get what you pay for. Firstly, the location is not for tourists as it's in a business area and all there is on the weekends is the tiny mall it's attached to and a lot of homeless people all over the area. Parking was my biggest beef, firstly I self-parked and they charged me the extra $4 for Valet even though I was clearly asked and given directions for Self-Parking at check in. I've left 2 messages to the hotel since my stay 1.5 weeks ago and they have failed to rectify the $4. The self parking is located 5 floors up then you have to take the mall elevator back to the ground floor and walk from one end of the mall to the other where the hotel is then go back up the hotel elevator. The hotel is old and tired. I wanted directions to the Staples Center and it was like pulling teeth from the bellboys who were too busy chatting with each other. The Staples Center is about the only place you can walk to as there is nothing else in the area. The location is definitely not for families as you get a homeless person asking you for changing every block and you're lucky if they leave you alone or follow you for a block or two trying hard for change. We went to inside Subway to get a sandwich and the homeless guy waited for us and followed us back to the hotel. Overall, the hotel deserves all the bad ratings it is receiving.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down and Tired ... especially for $250/night.”
Reviews.Author: FeltonS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights during a recent convention, and I found myself asking the same question every night: how on earth does Sheraton get off charging $250/night for a room with worn out brown carpet and run-down furniture that looks like it was installed in the 1970s? It's not that the hotel is terrible - it's just that it's not very good. All of the things that you expect from a Sheraton - like across-the-board good service - just don't happen here. For example, the in-house internet. It is spotty, with frequent outages. But my call to guest services to resolve the problem merely resulted in the operator transfering the caller to an AT&T operators and a ten minute wait to talk to someone who couldn't resolve the problem. So, instead, I found myself waiting an additional twenty minutes for the network to come back on. And that's what happens, and how you resolve a problem, when a hotel decides to outsource a basic service. I must say, some of the employees are very good. And some are very bad and in need of training. For example, one night my key card was demagnetized and I asked the front desk to reprogram it. The fellow put it in the machine, claimed to re-program it, and then I returned to my room ... where it didn't open the door. I returned to the front desk, asked him to do it again, he did ... and it still didn't open the door. This happened twice more before he figured out how to do it. Not good. It's no accident that this hotel is rated a 3.5 stars on tripadvisor: the management and staff have earned it This is not up to Sheraton standards AT ALL. Take my word: there are better hotels with cheaper rates within walking distance. I suggest trying one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Carmen- Ms. Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TRVLQUENN
Reviews.Content: Okay...so just to let you know i LOVED it there, as many problems as i encountered Carmen had the solution. it began horribly as the ac understandibly was just not strong enough for the room; there was a problem i believe with the bandwith and i had the hardest time connecting to the internet ; i ordered room service and that came back cold...so what did i do? went to the front desk and SCREAMED my [---] off. Fortuntaely, it was Carmen. she was apologetic, patient, and seemed so understandable about the situation. i was able to relocate to another room, was given a voucher for breakfast, and although she couldn't fix the internet herself, she staed on a conference call between me and at&t untill they were able to solve the problem. no matter how upset i was she stayed so calm about it all. i delivered a special gift (money) to the front desk, and upon check out it was back under my door with a card where she wrote a quote i would rather not say so i could use it at my next event!

Reviews.Title: “Great service - Libby treated me like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: AdamS256
